org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing

Class KeyFrames.Builder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing.KeyFrames.Builder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the values the KeyFrames instance constructed by this builder will hold.
    Enclosing class:
    KeyFrames<T>

    @NotThreadSafe
@TrackPartiallyInitialized
public static final class KeyFrames.Builder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to construct KeyFrames instances.

    Instances of this class are not thread safe and are intended to be thread-confined. However, the KeyFrames objects produces are thread-safe.

    Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.

    Author:
    Tim Halloran

      • KeyFrames.Builder

        public KeyFrames.Builder(T startValue)
        Constructs an key frames builder instance and specifies the first, or starting, key frame.
        Parameters:
        startValue - the key frame value at zero. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.

    • Method Detail

      • addFrame

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrame(T value)
        Adds a frame to the list of key frames being built.

        The time fraction when this fame occurs will be calculated, linearly, from the previous and next specified time fractions.

        The interpolator between the previous key frame and the one being added is set with setInterpolator(Interpolator) or the default LinearInterpolator will be used. The first key frame does not have an interpolator.

        Parameters:
        value - the value for the key frame. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addFrame

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrame(T value,
                            double atTimeFraction)
        Adds a frame to the list of key frames being built.

        The interpolator between the previous key frame and the one being added is set with setInterpolator(Interpolator) or the default LinearInterpolator will be used. The first key frame does not have an interpolator.

        Parameters:
        value - the value for the key frame. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        atTimeFraction - the time fraction in the range [0,1] when the value should occur. A negative value indicates that the time fraction when this fame occurs should be calculated, linearly, from the previous and next specified time fractions.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addFrame

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrame(T value,
                            Interpolator interpolator)
        Adds a frame to the list of key frames being built.

        The time fraction when this fame occurs will be calculated, linearly, from the previous and next specified time fractions.

        Parameters:
        value - the value for the key frame. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        interpolator - the interpolator that should be used between the previous key frame and the one being added. A null value indicates that either the interpolator set with setInterpolator(Interpolator) or the default LinearInterpolator should be used for this key frame. The first key frame does not have an interpolator—if set, it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addFrame

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrame(T value,
                            double atTimeFraction,
                            Interpolator interpolator)
        Adds a frame to the list of key frames being built.
        Parameters:
        value - the value for the key frame. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        atTimeFraction - the time fraction in the range [0,1] when the value should occur. A negative value indicates that the time fraction when this fame occurs should be calculated, linearly, from the previous and next specified time fractions.
        interpolator - the interpolator that should be used between the previous key frame and the one being added. A null value indicates that either the interpolator set with setInterpolator(Interpolator) or the default LinearInterpolator should be used for this key frame. The first key frame does not have an interpolator—if set, it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

        Adds a frame to the list of key frames being built.
        Parameters:
        frame - a frame.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if frame is null.
        See Also:
        KeyFrames.Frame

      • addFrames

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrames(T... values)
        Adds a list of frames to the list of key frames being built.

        This is a convenience method that invokes addFrame(Object) for each of the passed values.

        Parameters:
        values - a series values. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addFrames

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> addFrames(java.util.List<T> values)
        Adds a list of frames to the list of key frames being built.

        This is a convenience method that invokes addFrame(Object) for each of the passed values.

        Parameters:
        values - a series values. Client code should never mutate values that have been passed into a key frames instance. The behavior of the constructed key frames instance is undefined if its values are mutate by client code.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setInterpolator

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> setInterpolator(Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets the global interpolator to be used for the list of key frames being built. This value will override any interpolators set on individual frames.

        A value of null will clear the global interpolator, if any, that was previously set via a call to this method and use the interpolators set on individual frames.

        Parameters:
        interpolator - a global interpolator, or null to clear any previously set global interpolator.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setEvaluator

        public KeyFrames.Builder<T> setEvaluator(Evaluator<T> evaluator)
        Sets the evaluator between values for the list of key frames being built.

        Typically, this method does not need to be called because build() obtains an Evaluator instance by examining the type of the values the KeyFrames instance constructed by this builder will hold and calling KnownEvaluators.getEvaluatorFor(Class).

        If the type of the values the KeyFrames instance constructed by this builder will hold is not known, then you will have to implement a custom evaluator for that type and pass it to this method—or to KnownEvaluators.register(Evaluator).

        A value of null will clear the evaluator, if any, that was previously set via a call to this method and have build() invoke KnownEvaluators.getEvaluatorFor(Class) to obtain an Evaluator instance.

        Parameters:
        evaluator - an evaluator, or null to clear any previously set evaluator.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        See Also:
        KnownEvaluators

      • build

        public KeyFrames<T> build()
        Constructs a key frames instance with the settings defined by this builder.
        Returns:
        a key frames instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the settings defined by this builder are invalid and are not conducive to the construction of a valid key frames instance.
